boardgame.name: The Ultimate Micro-RPG Book
boardgame.description:
40 Fast, Easy, and Fun Tabletop Games

Publisher's blurb:

Enjoy these 40 expertly crafted micro-RPGs that are fast, fun, easy to learn, and come in a variety of genres—from space exploration to jungle dungeon crawlers—everything you need to pick up and play today.

Get gaming fast with The Ultimate Micro-RPG Book including brand-new micro-RPGs created by experts across the gaming world. From space exploration to jungle dungeon crawlers this book has everything you need to pick up and play today.

With these quick-start games, you can create your own adventures, alone or with friends, without any prep, and with minimal set up and pieces. Whether you’re new to RPGs or working towards your level 20 mage, this collection is a great way to try out different games and systems, and test your roleplay skills on different character types and situations.

The first 3 are announced simulating a group stage prior to the direct elimination stage. The other 4, as part of that stage. In that second stage, all the classified selections are shown and which are advancing and which are staying along the way.

boardgame.name: A Scurvy Band of Pirates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Arrrrrr! Do ye be looking for a quick guide for a one-shot story idea for Pirates of Pugmire? Well, don't be goin too far now, cause I got what yer want here.

This booklet contains a 1 page outline for a Pirates of Pugmire one-shot and 5 ready-made characters ready to sail the Acid Sea!

You've got a Mystic, Gundog, Torpedo, Ratter, and a Crusader ready for you to bring into your game.

Check it out and then come back and leave a review!


Works best with access to Pugmire, Monarchies of Mau, and Pirates of Pugmire*

boardgame.name: d444 Weapons Table

A supplement for MÖRK BORG with more weapons and dual wielding rules.

boardgame.name: Seven Palms for Seven Psalms
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

A strange Misery-stopping friend...

What more needs to be said? Use your real hands in this disgusting meatspace to play some slug-frog-snake or some finger-flashing with ᴛʜᴇᴍ; if you win enough times, perhaps you can stall the apocalypse for at least one more day. That may not sound like much, but, in the Dying World of MÖRK BORG, each day counts.

Additionally, listen closely and experience second-hand existential dread. ᴛʜᴇʏ know things—like how reality ceases to exist when you're not playing.

boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Checkmörk is a collection of chess themed enemies for MÖRK BORG.

boardgame.name: IQ Files: Pecados
boardgame.description:
IQ FILES - Pecados is a card ESCAPE ROOM game.

It consists in card scape room where 5-6 character that are met in a room, without knowing each other, they will have to find the Exit, resolving several kind of tests: logical, deduction, jigsaw. but be careful!! they can die while they are trying to find the way out!!

There are more than 90 cards in the adventure.

Each card have also a combination number and you can combine any two cards (objects, characters) and see what happen.

The game mixes several kind of mechanics and keep the players in suspense till the end.

Although you can play alone, it's easier to play with more people to help each other.

Each adventure have a level of difficulty from 1 to 10.

Game take from 90 to 120 minutes and there are 2 ways of playing.

Play with chronometer: you only have 90 minutes to finish.
Play with no chronometer: we really suggest this way as you can enjoy the better what's happening in the adventure .

Adventure 1: LIBERACIÓN Difficulty 4/10

Adventure 2: PECADOS Difficulty 6/10

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Shipping cost not included, please contact us at info@doitgames.com

boardgame.name: Magnet-Auto-Spiel
boardgame.description: The objective of the game is to navigate a car through a nature track using a magnet underneath the game board. A driving pole is used to move the magnet underneath the board. The player that navigates the car to the end of the track with the least mistakes, i.e. knocking over obstacles, in the least amount of time wins.

boardgame.name: Betelgeuse: The Celestial Strategy Game
boardgame.description:
Betelgeuse is an abstract game with a space theme; the 397-space hexagonal board depicts Betelgeuse in the center and six other stars near the corners. Players have a supply of stars in their colors.

On a turn a player rolls two dice and places one star with each them; the number rolled determines how many spaces away the new star must be from a printed star (at the start of the game) or a player's own star (later on).

Getting three of own's own stars adjacent in a triangle destroys opposing stars in a certain radius and prevents further play there.

Each player also has a single black hole which can be placed to cause additional destruction, and there is a neutral comet piece which also destroys things; the comet is moved when a player rolls doubles.

There is an advanced game in which players form "solar systems" by encircling empty spaces or the printed stars.

boardgame.name: 22Mars
boardgame.description:
100 years after 21Moon, the year is 2217 and the space race has moved from the Moon to Mars. Earth is suffering from climate crisis and over population. The players, space entrepreneurs, are building train tracks and colonies, creating a new bright future on the red planet while the risk for a revolt grows...

22Mars is an dystopian 18xx game set on Mars with variable map based on four interconnected megahexes and building track between variable value colonies depending on how many colonists are there.

The story so far – deportation of convicts, mining and space tourism on Mars

The year is 2217. Due to climate changes, the habitable parts of Earth are now heavily overpopulated. As one of several drastic measures to handle the population density, convicts on Earth are sent to colonies on Mars to work alongside androids and robots to build infrastructure for an alternative place to live. Ground-breaking technical leaps thanks to new hyper effective power source found on the moon have paved the way for time and cost-effective space travel, which in turn has made it possible to establish colonies on Mars. A number of corporations are contracted by the governments on Earth to build infrastructure necessary for building and supporting colonies on Mars. The first phase of Mars project focus on deportation of convicts from Earth, mining activities and space tourism for the privileged.

boardgame.name: Chrono Quest
boardgame.description:
Chrono Quest (Explora in France) is an adventure game, an historical adventure where the player (accused of murdering their father) travels to different time periods on a quest to find their father's true murderer.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chrono_Quest Chrono Quest]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Chrono Quest 2
Chrono Quest II
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Chrono Quest II (Explora II in France) is a adventure game where the player need to use the time machine Explora to solve a mystery.

boardgame.name: Explora 3: Sous le signe du serpent
Explora III: Sous le signe du serpent
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Explora III (Chrono Quest III if released in english) is a adventure game with a theme of time travelling and mystery.

boardgame.name: Yard Builder
boardgame.description:
A relaxing drawing game where you design and layout the best yard on a grid. Combo unique yard features like trampolines, fountains and swimming pools to add to your curb appeal.

For 1-99 players. Plays well over Skype or Zoom. Requires 3 20-sided dice. If you don't have d20's, there's a Yard Builder Dice Roller that you can load in any browser.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Righting a Wrong
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A would be band of adventurers find them self’s helping a wizard collect artefacts from evil necromancers to lock them away for the good of the land and the people that make it their home

intended for a party of 5 from level 1-5

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as three PDF files and a ZIP archive of maps, including:


17-page scenario
21-page Monsters and NPCs
1-page reference tables

boardgame.name: The GAMES 100 Game
boardgame.description:
The GAMES 100 Game is played on two boards, one for each phase of the game. Some spaces on the boards show snippets of photos from the Games 100 (in the same issue).

In phase one players move around the first board using chips numbered 1-3; playing a chip allows a player to move exactly that number of spaces. If a player lands on a space with a picture they claim it with a marker; other spaces have instructions which are followed. If a player cannot move they take one of the played chips.

When a player has occupied enough photo spaces phase two begins on the second board; the player ending phase one gets to transfer their markers to this board, which block the other players. The first player to reach the ending space wins.

boardgame.name: Extinción
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Extinción es un juego de rol de ciencia ficción ambientado en un futuro tenebroso y protagonizado por Personajes que tratan de sobrevivir en un universo implacable.

boardgame.name: Space Knights
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Space Knights is a science fiction roleplaying game about alien invasions, mighty warriors and desperate battles in the dark future. The player characters in Space Knights are no individuals but the companies of an Order of Elite Warriors in a time when humankind has spread through the galaxy and fights for survival. Space Knights uses a PbtA-based system and contains everything you need to play.

You will cross the galaxy, taking on the battles that no one else can fight. You will face ruthless aliens, explore desolated worlds and perform terrible deeds just to give humankind one more day before extinction. You will overcome these challenges by the might of your arm and soul… or you will face a destiny worse than death.

boardgame.name: Mystery in the Chicken Church
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Mystery in the Chicken Church, a group of level 4 adventurers takes on a mission investigating the recent disappearances and murders in the forest, near Moe's Winery. Things have gotten worse as time passes and some people believe that the strange chicken-shaped church in the woods has something to do with it. Unknown to all is the fact that an evil cockatrice-worshipping cult calls it its lair. The charismatic cult's leader plans to take over a small town soon.

It is up to a team of valiant warriors to stop the cultists from achieving their ill goals.

Explore fantasy worlds and immersive adventures!

boardgame.name: META
MΣTΔ
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MΣTΔ is an old school inspired role-playing game of metalanguage, metagaming, and metaphysics, to be played alone or in a group, with or without a gamemaster.

"MΣTΔS" is also how the player characters are called. A MΣTΔ is an individual disembodied mind, part of the ΩMNIMΣTΔ collective, an extremely evolved intelligent species of dimensional travelers that transcended time and space. Groups of MΣTΔS incarnate in various worlds, in order to experience the universe and know themselves.

To play MΣTΔ, the player or players will need this book, pen and paper, some copies of the different sheets, and at least one die with 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 20, 24, and 30 sides (or a way to roll those dice digitally). Other old school RPG books may come in hand.

boardgame.name: MERC vs X: Professional Level
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mini cyberpunk game. Deploy your group in dangerous missions with the help of high-tech equipment and cyber-enhanced specialists.

boardgame.name: Real Robot Techa-Mech: Professional Level
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mini game of the Real Robot Mecha genre in the style of Robotech and Gundam. Design your own mecha and take part in dangerous missions in your special pilot division.

boardgame.name: Arma
boardgame.description:
Arma is a chariot racing game where two players alternate “shooting” a wooden disc called a chariot around an oval racetrack. Each player attempts a lap and a half around the entire board without being knocked into the gutter. The first player to successfully complete five of these laps will win the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bloodsprint [Massacre]
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Play as a cyberpunk vampire in a biker gang performing suicide missions. You may be a monster but you are a professional. Upgrade your body and your lair in a minimalistic d6-based rule-system.
